Key Match Events: Royce Lewis hit a two-run double in the seventh inning with the bases loaded.
Jordyn Adams hit a 419-foot solo homer off Jorge Alcala in the sixth inning.
Taylor Ward hit a 416-foot leadoff homer in the first inning.
Nolan Schanuel hit a 382-foot solo homer to right field in the third inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Twins manager Rocco Baldelli praised Royce Lewis for his great swing, saying it was a 'nice Royce moment.'
The Twins manager also mentioned that the team had a bunch of guys that could go out there and pitch, which led to a shorter leash with starting pitcher Zebby Matthews.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins won the final two of their three-game series against the Los Angeles Angels.
The game was played in front of an announced crowd of 15,660 at Target Field in Minneapolis.
The Angels had gotten within a run when Jordyn Adams hit a 419-foot solo homer off Jorge Alcala in the sixth inning.
Others: The Twins utilized five relievers after a short day from Zebby Matthews, who allowed two runs off five hits while fanning five across 3 1/3 innings.
Jhoan Duran pitched the ninth inning and picked up his 23rd save of the year.
Cole Sands picked up his seventh win of the year for the Twins.
